item.title: New criteria for the rectifiability of Radon measures in terms of Riesz transforms
item.description: arXiv:2512.14534v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper we explore the connection between quantitative rectifiability of measures and the $L^2$ boundedness of the codimension one Riesz transform. Among other things, we prove the following. Let $\mu$ be a Radon measure in $\mathbb R^{n+1}$ with growth of degree $n$ such that the $n$-dimensional Riesz transform $R_\mu$ is bounded in $L^2(\mu)$, and let $B_0\subset\mathbb R^{n+1}$ be a suitably doubling ball such that: (i) There exists some (small) ball $B_1$ centered in $B_0$ with $r(B_1)\leq \delta_1 r(B_0)$ such that, for some constant $\alpha>0$, $$\frac{\mu(B_1)}{r(B_1)^n}\geq \alpha\,\frac{\mu(B_0)}{r(B_0)^n}.$$ (ii) For some $\epsilon>0$, $$\int_{2B_0} |R\mu - m_{\mu,2B_0}(R\mu)|^2\,d\mu\leq \epsilon\,\bigg(\frac{\mu(B_0)}{r(B_0)^n}\bigg)^2\,\mu(B_0).$$ If $\delta_1$ is small enough, depending on $n$ and $\alpha$, and $\epsilon$ is small enough, then there exists a uniformly $n$-rectifiable set $\Gamma$ and some $\tau>0$ such that $\mu(\Gamma\cap B_0) \geq\tau\,\mu(B_0).$
item.dc:creator: Xavier Tolsa

item.title: Bidiagonal matrix factorisations related to multiple orthogonal polynomials
item.description: arXiv:2412.03694v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We provide necessary and sufficient conditions for the Hessenberg recurrence matrix associated with a system of multiple orthogonal polynomials to admit a factorisation as a product of bidiagonal matrices. Using the Gauss-Borel factorisation of the moment matrix, we show that the nontrivial entries of those bidiagonal matrices can be expressed in terms of coefficients of type I or type II multiple orthogonal polynomials on the step-line with respect to the original system and its Christoffel transformations. Using the connection of multiple orthogonal polynomials with branched continued fractions, we show that the nontrivial entries of the bidiagonal matrices in the factorisation of the Hessenberg recurrence matrix correspond to the coefficients of a branched continued fraction associated with the given system of multiple orthogonal polynomials. As a case study, we present an explicit bidiagonal factorisation for the Hessenberg recurrence matrices of the Jacobi-Pi\~neiro polynomials and, as a limiting case, the multiple Laguerre polynomials of first kind.
item.dc:creator: Am\'ilcar Branquinho, Juan E. F. D\'iaz, Ana Foulqui\'e-Moreno, H\'elder Lima, Manuel Ma\~nas

item.title: A few identities and integrals involving Pochhammer symbols, Jacobi polynomials, and the hypergeometric function
item.description: arXiv:2504.15161v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We expand a hypergeometric function in an orthogonal series of Jacobi polynomials. We first identify identities involving the Pochhammer symbol (rising factorial). We utilize them to discover closed forms for certain integrals of Jacobi polynomials that are multiplied by a hypergeometric function and a Beta density. We can also obtain closed forms for particular series that consist of rising factorials, which generalize binomial series, by using well-known properties of the hypergeometric function. We can also get some simplifying identities of generalized hypergeometric functions.
item.dc:creator: Pawe{\l} J. Szab{\l}owski

item.title: Kovalevskaya exponents of the Riccati hierarchy
item.description: arXiv:2511.16994v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: This article presents a new expression for Riccati chains using Bell polynomials. The quasi-homogeneous properties of these chains are explored, and the Kovalevskaya exponents are analyzed. The commuting vector fields of Riccati hiearchy are also identified.
item.dc:creator: Changyu Zhou

item.title: Morse index theorem for heteroclinic, homoclinic and halfclinic orbits of Lagrangian systems
item.description: arXiv:2004.08643v4 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: The purpose of this paper is to prove a new, more general version of the Morse index theorem for heteroclinic, homoclinic, and half-clinic solutions in general Lagrangian systems. In the final section, we compute the Morse index for specific heteroclinic and half-clinic solutions in classical mechanical models such as the mathematical pendulum, the Nagumo equation, and a four-dimensional competition-diffusion system.
item.dc:creator: Xijun Hu, Alessandro Portaluri, Li Wu, Qin Xing
